comments.body: We should consider a helper that does all the buildInfo->environment dictionary parts of this, since I think at least the three desktop platforms will end up having identical code.

Its slightly different for all three, since linux uses a makefile export and macOS uses the xcodeproj. There is definitely some refactoring we could do here to make it more sane, but I'll leave that for another day

I know the way we publish the environment variables vary, it's the process of turning buildInfo into key/value pair that I was thinking we should collect in one place. Then each build system can do the trivial work of converting a dictionary of key/value pairs to the format of their choice (without any knowledge of what the keys and values actually are).
